api/Atrea.PolicyEngine.html.title: Namespace Atrea.PolicyEngine | Atrea.PolicyEngine
api/Atrea.PolicyEngine.html.keywords: Namespace Atrea.PolicyEngine Interfaces IAsyncPolicyEngine<T> An async policy engine which will check if an item should be processed with its input policies, process the item using its processors, then apply any post-processing to the item using its output policies. Note that this engine can be configured with non-async and async input policies, non-async, async, and parallel processors, and non-async, async, and parallel output policies. See AsyncPolicyEngineBuilder<T> for configuration of this async policy engine. IPolicyEngine<T> A policy engine which will check if an item should be processed with its input policies, process the item using its processors, then apply any post-processing to the item using its output policies. See PolicyEngineBuilder<T> for configuration of this policy engine.

api/Atrea.PolicyEngine.Policies.Input.In.title: Enum InputPolicyResult | Atrea.PolicyEngine
api/Atrea.PolicyEngine.Policies.Input.In.keywords: Enum InputPolicyResult A result of an IInputPolicy<T> , to be used by the IPolicyEngine<T> and IAsyncPolicyEngine<T> . Namespace : Atrea.PolicyEngine.Policies.Input Assembly : Atrea.PolicyEngine.dll Syntax public enum InputPolicyResult : int Fields Name Description Accept Accept the item as input and skip remaining input policies. Continue Accept the item for this given IInputPolicy<T> and continue evaluating remaining input policies, or begin processing if this is the result of the last input policy that has been run. Reject Reject the item as input - skip remaining input policies, processors, and output policies.
